subhed: Le Monde has learned that a 2018 security audit explicitly identified the balcony used by the thieves as a point of vulnerability, even noting the possibility that a freight lift could be used to access it.

The overlooked issue of domestic violence against elderly women
subhed: Among all women killed by their partners in France in 2024, 26% were over the age of 70, a figure that is on the rise. Yet, the murders of these women and the possible abuse that preceded them are poorly documented.

title: France's top architecture prize awarded to a school complex
subhed: Located in the Paris suburbs, the project by Gaëtan Le Penhuel & Associés creates shared spaces between the school and the recreation center.

title: Previously unknown Renoir painting sells for €1.8 million at auction
subhed: The oil painting by French impressionist painter August Renoir of his toddler son Jean had never before been exhibited or sold. The high-end art market has been experiencing a recent boon, with record-breaking sales in the past week alone for works by Frida Kahlo and Gustav Klimt.

title: Boualem Sansal: 'At my age, I am not about to learn to hold my tongue...'
subhed: The French-Algerian writer, who has been in France since November 18, has regained his freedom, including his freedom of speech. He recounts his yearlong detention in Algeria, discusses the remarks that led to his arrest, and reflects on the future of relations between France and Algeria.

title: France's cultural landmarks enter a time of costly makeovers
subhed: Lack of regular upkeep and the effects of climate change have forced many cultural institutions to undertake massive renovation projects, with costs expected to reach €5 billion over the next 10 years.

title: Niklas Frank, a son consumed by hatred for his Nazi father
subhed: Niklas Frank, an 86-year-old former journalist, is known in Germany for his absolute loathing of his father. As a Reich official, Hans Frank, appointed by Hitler in Poland, was among those sentenced to death at the Nuremberg trials, which began 80 years ago.
